alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 21 at 6:13PM EST until December 22 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hartford and Hampden Counties. Sudbury River At Saxonville affecting Middlesex County. For the Connecticut River...including Thompsonville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sudbury River...including Saxonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sudbury River at Saxonville. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding will affect low lying areas along the river in Wayland, including a portion of Shore Road and Pelham Island Road near Heards Pond. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 PM EST Thursday was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 8.7 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.4 feet on 04/02/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 700 AM EST.
